parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From timios; to prize, i.e. Fix a valuation upon; by implication, to revere.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
A mother. Apparently a primary word; a 'mother'.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Feminine Singular
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
First, before, principal, most important. Contracted superlative of pro; foremost.
An ordinance, injunction, command, law. From entellomai; injunction, i.e. An authoritative prescription.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A promise. From epaggello; an announcement.
